intro: Macaranga andamanica, commonly known as the Andaman nettle, is a flowering plant native to the Andaman and Nicobar Islands. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves with serrated edges. The plant produces small, greenish flowers arranged in clusters, and it is often found in moist, shaded forest understories. It has a rapid growth rate and is sometimes considered an invasive species in certain regions. Its latex contains compounds that can cause skin irritation.
